events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving their car and filed the initial claim with basic details about the collision and damages.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision reported by the client.
An agent was promptly assigned to the auto accident claim to begin customer assistance and process coordination.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the customer was informed that the investigation will begin shortly.
The insurance company requested photos of the vehicle damage, the police report, and witness statements to proceed with evaluation.
Customer submitted all required documents including police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
Investigation into the auto accident claim was initiated to verify details and assess the validity of the reported damages.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of the accident details and agreement on the extent of the damages reported.
A settlement offer was prepared based on repair costs and customer policy limits and sent to the claimant for review.
Customer provided positive feedback acknowledging the settlement proposal seemed fair and was satisfied with the timely service.
The claim was approved by the insurer after acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer and all criteria being met.
Payment was issued to the customer for the repair costs as agreed in the settlement proposal for the auto accident claim.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment issuance and customer satisfaction.
All claim documents and communications were archived for record-keeping and future reference for the concluded auto accident claim.
